Description: Survey was conducted in October 1967 in a Pine forest (33-34 year old) in Shizuoka Prefecture (Kabaya and Satoo 1968). All trees in a 41.8-square-meter plot were felled.

M. Ishihara, H. Utsugi, H. Tanouchi, and T. Hiura conducted formal search of reference databases and digitized raw data from Kabaya and Satoo (1968). Based on this reference, meta data was also created by M. Ishihara. Species name and family names were converted by M. Ishihara according to the following references: Satake Y, Hara H (1989a) Wild flower of Japan Woody plants I (in Japanese). Heibonsha, Tokyo; Satake Y, Hara H (1989b) Wild flower of Japan Woody plants II (in Japanese). Heibonsha, Tokyo.
